byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Michael Gordon contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Mark W Lippert, United States ambassador to South Korea, is attacked in Seoul by knife-wielding man Kim Ki-jong, who says he opposes military exercises being carried out between South Korea and US; Lippert is taken to hospital with facial wound.
lead_paragraph: The ambassador, Mark W. Lippert, was in stable condition after the attack by a South Korean assailant protesting joint American-South Korean military exercises.

headline.main: Mark Lippert, U.S. Ambassador to South Korea, Is Hospitalized After Attack
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ambassador to South Korea Hospitalized After Attack

snippet: The ambassador, Mark W. Lippert, was in stable condition after the attack by a South Korean assailant protesting joint American-South Korean military exercises.
